formattedAddress: 200 W 41st St, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 200 W 41st St, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Humble, tiny pizzeria offering pizzas with a variety of meat and veggie toppings, plus finger foods.

originalText.text: Carnegie Pizza is a great spot near Times Square on 41st street ( just off Broadway and couple minutes walk from Times Square).  Its a bit tucked away but its easily one of my favourite pizza places in New York.  We tried tons of pizza places, lots of 99 cent pizzas and other places as there are tons in New York, but this place is on top of my list.   The pizzas are fantastic, stone baked, thin crust, lots of flavour and tons of varieties.  Place is busy inside and outside (as there are couple picnic tables to sit outside), but all the pizzas are fresh and lots of variety.  We tried few different ones and all were great.  Best of all the garlic knots are soooo good and greasy.. the garlic butter is so strong it will burn your tongue if you have too many (which i did as they are so damn good).  everything is fresh, and the guys working here have tons of fun with the customers and are quick.  its not a 99 cent pizza ( slices are $4-6) but its a very very good pizza.

originalText.text:
A very good and reasonably priced pizza place near Times Square!

There is definitely better pizza elsewhere in the city… but for this location, cost, and speed this is definitely 5/5.

Don’t wait in line for Joe’s, come here instead.

The crust was crisp and airy, the sauce had good flavor to it, and tons of topping options for you to choose from.

originalText.text: Some of the best pizza I've ever had! The dough is delicious light, airy, soft yet crispy. The sauce has just the right amount. Flavorful. The sitting area is small but there's sufficient space outside. I really appreciate the little standing counter as well. Guys behind the masterpiece work like a well oiled machine. Prepping, cooking and serving. Definitely worth a try if you are in the city. The spicy pepperoni slice was tasty as well.

text.text: Some of the best pizza I've ever had! The dough is delicious light, airy, soft yet crispy. The sauce has just the right amount. Flavorful. The sitting area is small but there's sufficient space outside. I really appreciate the little standing counter as well. Guys behind the masterpiece work like a well oiled machine. Prepping, cooking and serving. Definitely worth a try if you are in the city. The spicy pepperoni slice was tasty as well.

originalText.text: If you’re tired of waiting in the long queue in front of the overrated Joe’s pizza, congratulations you’re looking at the one of the underrated pizza outlets very close to Times Square. It’s definitely as tasty as Joe’s pizza, takes less time to wait. The only disadvantage with this outlet is that it is very small and dine in is pretty difficult. Otherwise we totally enjoyed the eggplant pizza in addition to the other tasty ones.

originalText.text: So good!! Perfect light crisp in crust, sauce is so flavorful, perfect amount of cheese. I got spinach & mushroom, my husband got pepperoni. Garlic knots are almost too garlicky but I love fresh garlic so yum! (We only wanted 2, but garlic knots come in a set of 5)
